newsitem.title: USA: Babcock & Wilcox to supply PS Colorado.
newsitem.headline: Babcock & Wilcox to supply PS Colorado.

text.p: Babcock & Wilcox Power Generation Group has been awarded a $31 million contract by Public Service Co of Colorado to supply environmental control equipment on the utility's Hayden Generating Station units 1 and 2.

B&W, an operating unit of McDermott International Inc, will supply a dry scrubber and 18 low NOx burners on unit 1, and a dry scrubber on unit 2. The contract is part of a consortium and open-book partnering arrangement between B&W, Black & Veatch Construction Inc and the Public Service Company Generation Engineering Division.

Hayden Generating Station is located in northwest Colorado. The 184-megawatt unit 1 and 262-megawatt unit 2 steam generators are pulverized-coal-fired and were commissioned in 1965 and 1976, B&W said.
Work at Hayden 1 is scheduled for completion in December 1998. Unit 2 completion is scheduled for December 1999.

Dry scrubbing involves spraying a highly atomized slurry or aqueous solution of an alkaline reagent into the hot flue gas to absorb sulfur dioxide emissions. The process is used primarily with lower-sulfur fuels.
The vertical-flow dry scrubbers for Hayden are the first sold by B&W since this technology was acquired from Joy Environmental Technologies Inc in late 1995, the company said.
